intro: Momordica dioica, commonly known as bitter gourd, is a vine belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its elongated, warty fruits that are typically green when immature and turn yellow or orange when mature. The plant has both male and female flowers on separate plants, a feature known as dioecy. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and trailing. The fruit is known for its sharp, bitter taste, which becomes milder as it ripens.
